newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian net reserves fall to 19.2 trln rbls.
newsitem.headline: Russian net reserves fall to 19.2 trln rbls.

text.p: Russia's net foreign currency reserves fell to 19.2 trillion roubles on July 1 from 21 trillion roubles on July 1, the central bank said on Thursday.
Reserves were calculated at a rate of 4,640 roubles to the dollar, it said in its weekly bulletin.
The central bank issued the following data (trillions of roubles):

Under Russia's $10 billion three-year loan from the International Monetary Fund, the Fund sets performance targets for the budget deficit, net domestic assets -- defined as the monetary base less net currency reserves -- and net reserves.
